H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5228.def: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H6049.def: = action by which someone foretells future events by using magic, casting spells, or conjuring up spirits; forbidden by the Law of Moses

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H5003.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H748.def: = to be long or to increase in length

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H6588.def: = action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H2552.def: = process by which human or inanimate objects feel or become warm or hot

H352.def: = male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat-tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H3206.def: = posterity of humans and or animals of undetermined sex, at an age ranging from before birth to adulthood

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H2506.def: = one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

H2511.def: = state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H1486.def: = specially marked object, such as a pebble or piece of pottery, ► used in order to decide questions

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H5262.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H4503.def: = objects given to a person of high status; ► sometimes this is done on a voluntary basis as a show of respect for the recipient and in order to win that person's favor; in other cases this is done to fulfill the requirements imposed by the recipient

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H1364.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2076.def: = causative action by which humans kill one or more animals, usually for food

H2077.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H310.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H4201.def: = upright part of a door frame; a few passages mention square door frames and in such cases the horizontal elements are also referred to as doorposts

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2146.def: = process by which humans retain knowledge of people from the past, or of things that have happened in the past

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7788.def: = action by which humans move from one place to another

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H7547.def: = spices that produce a fragrant smell

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H6735.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non-sanctioned rituals or as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2976.def: = process by which someone resigns to being unable to change a situation, and gives up trying to do so

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1672.def: = state in which humans experience fear, anxiety, or distress ◄ out of uncertainty of what might happen to themselves or their beloved ones; ► which may express itself in trembling and shaking of the body

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2814.def: = action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H5046.def: = causative action by which humans pass on information to others, usually by word of mouth

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H3276.def: = process by which someone's well-being is promoted by a certain action or event

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5549.def: literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans create a road or access ramp by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4383.def: = an obstacle that causes humans to trip or temporarily lose their balance when hitting it with their feet; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1793.def: = process by which something has been deformed or destroyed by heavy pressure

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H7107.def: = process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H5397.def: = the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H7107.def: = process by which humans in a position of authority or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7726.def: = a person or group that has turned away from someone they had pledged to serve

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H5148.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or animals to move or be moved from one place to another

H5150.def: = state in which deities experience a desire to make humans feel relief after a time of grief

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H1254.def: = causative action by which humans cause something else to get its desired shape by cutting off certain parts of it

H5108.def: literally: fruit of table; hence: = meat that is sacrificed on the altar

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7495.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans or animals to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself; ≈ often used figuratively to denote the state of a country or nation suffering from the consequences of their unfaithfulness

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H8252.def: = state in which an inanimate object does not move

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H7516.def: = wet soil; ◄ tossed up by the sea; ≈ regarded as a valueless substance

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
